intro: Psychotria pseudopavetta, commonly known as the false pavetta, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. Its flowers are clustered in cymes and are often white or pale pink, with five petals. Psychotria pseudopavetta is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in its native habitats.
